headline: Former Citi Executive’s Suit Raises Questions About Bank’s Culture
summary: Julia Carreon, a former managing director in wealth management, said harassment by the division’s head and others created a hostile work environment and damaged her reputation.

raw.headline: Former Citi Executive’s Suit Raises Questions About Bank’s Culture

headline: Participation notifications by Citigroup Inc.
summary: Press release Regulated information Brussels, January 28, 2026, 17:45 CET In line with Belgian transparency legislation (Law of May 2, 2007), Citigroup Inc. recently sent to Solvay the following transparency notifications indicating that they crossed the threshold of 3%. Here is a summary of the notifications: Date on which the threshold is crossed Voting rights after the transaction Equivalent financial instruments after the transaction Total January 19, 2026 0.56% 2.51 3.06% January 22, 2026 0

headline: Citi Denies Sexual Harassment Claims Against Wealth Head Andy Sieg, Seeks Arbitration
summary: The bank's filing contended that Julia Carreon’s sexual harassment complaint against Andy Sieg has “no factual or legal basis.” Carreon claimed she was a victim of “Citi’s discriminatory machinery,” including a “weaponized” Human Resources department.

raw.headline: Citi Denies Sexual Harassment Claims Against Wealth Head Andy Sieg, Seeks Arbitration

headline: Earnings Growth to Boost S&P 500 Up to 7,700, Citi's Chronert Says
summary: Scott Chronert, Citi US equity strategist, says he expects an acceleration in aggregate corporate earnings growth this year on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

headline: JPMorgan's 2026 NII Guide Signals Resilience: Is JPM Stock a Buy Now?
summary: JPM projects 2026 NII of $103B despite rate cuts, banking on loan growth, card balances and deposit gains. Does this justify betting on the stock? Let's find out.

headline: Citi Sees Diversification Trade 'Being Stronger' in 2026
summary: Beata Manthey, Citigroup's European equity strategy head, comments on recent FX market moves in the EUR/USD trade and "re-emerging" tariff risks. "We continue to see the diversification trade being stronger this year," Manthey tells Bloomberg Television. "What is happening geopolitically around the world really re-emphasizes the domestic trade in Europe."

headline: Mining stocks have been on a tear, with gold passing $5,000. Analysts are split on what's next
summary: Appetite for mining stocks has cooled over the past six months, according to a Citi note.
